class="zn-body__paragraph speakable">Now, Edward Snowden might never live in the United States as a free man again. Where he may end up was a source of global speculation Sunday after he flew from Hong Kong to Russia, his ultimate destination unknown to most.</div><div class="zn-body__paragraph speakable">Snowden has revealed himself as the source of documents outlining a massive effort by the U.S. National Security Agency to track cell phone calls and monitor the e-mail and Internet traffic of virtually all Americans. </div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">Snowden, 29, said he just wanted the public to know what the government was doing. </div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">"Even if you're not doing anything wrong you're being watched and recorded," he said. </div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">Snowden told The Guardian newspaper in the United Kingdom that he had access to the full rosters of "https://schema.org","@type": "VideoObject","name": "Obama answers outcry over NSA ","description": "CNN&#39;s Brooke Baldwin talks about the NSA&#39;s second surveillance program.","thumbnailURL": "https://www.cnn.com/videos/bestoftv/2013/06/07/exp-nr-nsa-ben-ferguson.cnn","url": "https://www.cnn.com/videos/bestoftv/2013/06/07/exp-nr-nsa-ben-ferguson.cnn","embedUrl": data-video-id="bestoftv/2013/06/07/exp-nr-nsa-ben-ferguson.cnn"></div><div id="body-text_9-metadata" class="metadata"><p class="metadata__source"><span class="metadata__source-name"></span></p></div></div><div class="media__caption el__storyelement__title"><span class="el__storyelement__header">Obama answers outcry over NSA </span> <span class="el__storyelement__gray">11:30</span></div></div></div></div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">"I'm just another guy who sits there day to day in the office, watching what's happening, and goes, 'This is something that's not our place to decide.' The public needs to decide whether these programs or policies are right or wrong," he said. </div><div class="zn-body__paragraph"><a href="http://cnn.com/2013/06/10/politics/nsa-leak/index.html">Snowden fled to Hong Kong</a> after copying one last set of documents and telling his boss he needed to go away for medical treatment. </div><div class="zn-body__paragraph"><strong>From Hawaii to hiding </strong></div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">Before his leak of U.S. intelligence, Snowden was living "in paradise." </div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">He worked for a major U.S. government contractor in Hawaii, earning a six-figure salary and enjoying the scenic state with his girlfriend. </div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">He told The Guardian he never received a high school diploma and didn't complete his computer studies at a community college. Instead, he joined the Army in 2003 but was discharged after breaking both legs in an accident. </div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">Snowden said he later worked as a security guard for the NSA and then took a computer security job with the CIA. He left that job in 2009 and moved on to Booz Allen Hamilton, where he worked as a contractor for the government in Hawaii. </div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">He told the Guardian that he left for Hong Kong on May 20 without telling his family or his girlfriend what he planned.</div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">"You're living in Hawaii, in paradise and making a ton of money. What would it take to make you leave everything behind?" he said in the Guardian interview. </div><div class="el__embedded el__embedded--standard"><div class="el__video--standard js__video--standard" !Modernizr.tablet) {if (typeof videoPinner !== 'undefined' && videoPinner !== null) {videoPinner.setIsPlaying(true);videoPinner.animateDown();}}},onContentReplayRequest: function (containerId, cvpId, contentId) {if (Modernizr && !Modernizr.phone && !Modernizr.mobile && !Modernizr.tablet) {if (typeof videoPinner !== 'undefined' && videoPinner !== null) {videoPinner.setIsPlaying(true);var $endSlate = jQuery(document.getElementById(containerId)).parent().find('.js-video__end-slate').eq(0);if ($endSlate.length > 0) {$endSlate.removeClass('video__end-slate--active').addClass('video__end-slate--inactive');}}}},onContentBegin: function (containerId, cvpId, contentId) {if (mobilePinnedView) {mobilePinnedView.enable();}/* Dismissing the pinnedPlayer if another video players plays a video. */CNN.VideoPlayer.dismissMobilePinnedPlayer(containerId);CNN.VideoPlayer.mutePlayer(containerId);if (CNN.companion && typeof CNN.companion.updateCompanionLayout === 'function') {CNN.companion.updateCompanionLayout('removeEpicAds');}CNN.VideoPlayer.hideSpinner(containerId);clearTimeout(moveToNextTimeout);CNN.VideoSourceUtils.clearSource(containerId);jQuery(document).triggerVideoContentStarted();},onContentComplete: function (containerId, cvpId, contentId) {if (CNN.companion && typeof CNN.companion.updateCompanionLayout === 'function') {CNN.companion.updateCompanionLayout('restoreFreewheel');}navigateToNextVideo(contentId, containerId);},onContentEnd: function (containerId, cvpId, contentId) {if (Modernizr && !Modernizr.phone && visible) {CNN.VideoPlayer.handleAdOnCVPVisibilityChange(containerId, visible);}};if (typeof configObj.context !== 'string' || configObj.context.length <= 0) {configObj.context = class="media__video--responsive " data-video-id="bestoftv/2013/06/07/exp-pmt-bernie-sanders-patriot-act-nsa.cnn"></div><div id="body-text_20-metadata" class="metadata"><p class="metadata__source"><span class="metadata__source-name"></span></p></div></div><div class="media__caption el__storyelement__title"><span class="el__storyelement__header">Sanders: I voted against the Patriot Act</span> <span class="el__storyelement__gray">01:36</span></div></div></div></div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">"I'm willing to sacrifice all of that because I can't in good conscience allow the U.S. government to destroy privacy, Internet freedom and basic liberties for people around the world with this massive surveillance machine they're secretly building."</div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">Some residents on Oahu island are glad Snowden left.</div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">"From a Hawaii standpoint, good riddance, thanks for leaving," Ralph Cossa told <a href="http://www.khon2.com/2013/06/09/man-behind-nsa-leaks-worked-in-hawaii/" target="_blank">CNN affiliate KHON</a>. </div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">"I'm sure the guy had an overactive Mother Teresa gene and thought he was going to go out and save America from Americans, but in reality he was very foolish," Cossa said. "We expect the government to honor our privacy, but we also expect our government to protect us from terrorist attacks." </div><div class="zn-body__paragraph"><a href="http://www.cnn.com/2013/06/10/opinion/rushkoff-snowden-hero/index.html" target="_blank">Opinion: Snowden is a hero</a></div><div class="zn-body__paragraph"><strong>The fallou<strong></strong>t</strong></div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">President Barack Obama insists his administration is not spying on U.S. citizens -- rather, it's only looking for information on terrorists. </div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">Booz Allen Hamilton, the government contractor that employed Snowden, said Snowden had worked at the firm for less than three months. </div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">"News reports that this individual has claimed to have leaked classified information are shocking, and if accurate, this action represents a grave violation of the code of conduct and core values of our firm," <a href="http://www.boozallen.com/media-center/press-releases/48399320/statement-reports-leaked-information-060913" target="_blank">the company said</a> in the statement. The firm said it will cooperate with authorities in their investigation. </div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">According to the Guardian, the only time Snowden became emotional during hours of interviews was when he thought about what might happen to his relatives -- many of whom work for the U.S. government. </div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">"The only thing I fear is the harmful effects on my family, who I won't be able to help anymore," he said. "That's what keeps me up at night." </div><div class="zn-body__paragraph">As for his concerns about his country, "the greatest fear that I have regarding the outcome for America of these disclosures is that nothing will change."  </div><div class="zn-body__paragraph"><a href="http://cnn.com/2013/06/07/tech/web/nsa-internet-privacy">READ: Some shrug at NSA snooping: Privacy's already dead</a></div><div class="zn-body__paragraph"><a href="http://cnn.com/2013/06/07/politics/nsa-data-mining/index.html">Obama: No one listening to your calls</a></div><div class="zn-body__paragraph"><a
